hjb.jms.cmd
Interface JMSCommand

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseJMSCommand
public interface JMSCommand

JMSCommand declares the methods used to dispatch execution of JMS API methods, determine when execution of those methods is completed, and whether or not execution completed successfully.

The objects that use a JMSCommand (cf JMSCommandGenerators are expected to collaborate with a specific subclass; those specific implementation classes implement this interface to allow them to be executed using a JMSCommandRunner.

Author:
Tim Emiola
See Also:
JMSCommandGenerator

Method Detail

execute

public void execute()
Executes this JMSCommand's action.

This will involve invoking JMS API methods on configured JMS objects.

Throws:
HJBException - if a problem occurs during execution

isComplete

public boolean isComplete()
                   throws HJBException
Indicates whether the processing of this JMSCommand is completed.

This is necessary as the execute() method is expected to run on a different thread to one that created the JMSCommand. Implementations of this method are required to ensure that this method returns false if execute() has not been called or is still running, and true when it has finished.

Returns:
true when execute() has finished running, false otherwise.
Throws:
HJBException - if a problem occurs determining this value

isExecutedOK

public boolean isExecutedOK()
                     throws HJBException
Indicates whether the processing of this JMSCommand was successful.

This only has meaning after the method execute() has been invoked. Prior to that, the results of invoking this method are not defined.

Returns:
true if the command completed execution without problems, false otherwise.
Throws:
HJBException - if a problem occurs determining this value

getDescription

public String getDescription()
                      throws HJBException
Provides a description of this JMSCommand.

Returns:
a description of this JMSCommand
Throws:
HJBException - if a problem occurs while generating the description

getStatusMessage

public String getStatusMessage()
                        throws HJBException
Provides a status message describing the results of executing this JMSCommand.

The status only has meaning after the method execute() has been invoked. Prior to that, the result of invoking this method is not defined.

Returns:
a status message describing of the results of executing this JMSCommand
Throws:
HJBException - if a problem occurs while generating the status

getFault

public HJBException getFault()
                      throws HJBException
Obtains the fault describing the problem that caused execution of this JMSCommand to fail.

This only has meaning after the method execute() has been invoked if isExecutedOK() is false. Implementations should return null in all other circumstances.

Returns:
the exception thrown that caused this JMSCommand to fail
Throws:
HJBException - if a problem occurs while obtaining the fault exception
